attributes.action: There is a high risk of the wargrave fire station being closed.
attributes.additional_details: Not too long ago there was a fire in wargrave due to the crew not being called out by the call centre local station (Wokingham) attended which took them 32 minutes to respond which is too long the incident which occurred was a burning car well a light on a busy road with many people about, the wargrave station was literally 20/30m down the road but were not called out.
attributes.background: This fire station has been in use just after world war 2, the station and crew cover around the local community. Here is the areas they are closer to then any other station, wargrave,hurst,Henley on Thames, twyford, sonning and woodley these areas are highly populated so please please help.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept your petition because the UK Government or Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. 

Wargrave fire station is the responsibility of the Royal Berkshire Fire and Rescue Service.

The Royal Berkshire Fire and Rescue Service are consulting until the end of March 2017 on the future of the service . You can find out more information here:
http://www.rbfrs.co.uk/consultation/

You could also contact local representative about this. You can use this page to find out who the local councillors are and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
